meanings.definition: A person who delays or procrastinates.
meanings.sent1: The cunctators in the group always arrived late to meetings.
meanings.sent2: The team was frustrated with the cunctators who never submitted their work on time.
meanings.sent3: The cunctators at the party took forever to decide on a game to play.
meanings.sent4: Her cat was a true cunctator, always taking its time to finish its meals.
meanings.sent5: The cunctators in the marathon lagged behind, enjoying the scenery along the way.

meanings.sent1: Please do not cunctators when it comes to completing your homework.

meanings.sent4: The clouds seemed to cunctators, delaying the arrival of the much-needed rain.
meanings.sent5: She couldn't help but cunctators before making a decision about which movie to watch.
